segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, and it’s just getting worse by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in the middle of it, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the puddle spreading across the floor, and it’s only a matter of time before someone slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and the woman is completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the water is going to ruin the cabinets if she doesn’t turn it off soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool, and it’s making me nervous just watching him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman is just ignoring the mess or if she’s really that unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should do something, but I don’t know what.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is while everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR
